Leveraging cutting-edge AI tools to supercharge development velocity, code quality, and system architecture. Each tool serves a strategic purpose in my workflow.

Cursor AI

IDE

My primary development environment. Cursor transforms VSCode into an AI-first IDE. I use it for rapid prototyping, generating boilerplate code, and real-time pair programming. The context-aware suggestions feel like having a senior developer looking over my shoulder 24/7.

GitHub Copilot

Assistant

The OG AI coding assistant. Copilot handles the heavy lifting of repetitive patterns, test generation, and documentation. It's trained on billions of lines of code, making it invaluable for idiomatic implementations and discovering best practices I might have missed.

Function autocomplete

Claude (Anthropic)

Architect

The brain behind complex system design. When I need to refactor a massive codebase, design a scalable architecture, or reason through intricate technical decisions, Claude's 200K context window is unmatched. It understands nuance, catches edge cases, and thinks several steps ahead.

System architecture design

Technical documentation

Devin AI

Autonomous

The autonomous software engineer. Devin doesn't just suggest codeit executes entire tasks end-to-end. From setting up CI/CD pipelines to debugging production issues across multiple services, Devin operates independently while I focus on strategic decisions. It's like having a junior dev who never sleeps.

End-to-end feature development

Research

My research and strategy partner. Gemini Pro excels at dynamic research, competitive analysis, and business modeling.
